physicalDescription.note: On envelope: "#1091 JCRS Postcards of Campus c. 1902". On back of photograph: "The main hospital, had four wings very large, #1091." On front of photograph: "J.C.R.S. New Main Building"

mods.abstract: Main hospital building located on the east side of JCRS. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Photograph was donated by Sarah Holcolm Florida.
